Class RPCreceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • RPCreceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class RPCreceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Defines multithreaded RPC stub for lib440lib.so clients.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Method used to start RPCreceiver.

        This opens a TCP port specified in environment variable proxyport15440. Listens for new clients (which use lib440lib.so), and launches new threads to handle each client. It calls the factory object's newclient method to get a new FileHandling instance for each client. For each RPC, the corresponding methods in the FileHandling object are called on behalf of the client.

        This method is compatible with Runnable interface, so RPCreceiver can be run as a separate thread. This method does not return.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
